text: Say “hello” to the project team, Lilah.
speaker: max

text: Hello, project team.
speaker: lilah

text: And, are we having a wonderful time here in Xanadu?
speaker: max

text: Oh, yes! Only, there are not quite enough mosquitos.
speaker: lilah

text: Have we thought much about Ceres?
speaker: max

text: Ceres? What's that?
speaker: lilah

text: Heh, see folks? Mission accomplished.
speaker: max

text: Uh, not quite. I have another mission:\To rid this world once and for all of Max's shorts.
speaker: lilah

text: What's wrong with my shorts?
speaker: max

text: <Laughs> You've gotta be kidding!
speaker: lilah

text: Well… I'm a scientist, dammit! Not some model.
speaker: max

text: Oh, I think we can all attest to that.
speaker: lilah

text: That's it! Cut!
speaker: max

text: And have her desk cleared out by the time I get back.
speaker: max

text: Hey! Come on, blow out the candles!
speaker: partygoer1

text: Well, I tried to find 100, you know,\one for each day in orbit?
speaker: partygoer2

text: Really? I thought it was for how\many hours a week they work.

text: <Cheering>
Oh, I don't know if I can go through with this!\It's taking off, it's… it's like…
speaker: lilah

text: Like leaving our child
speaker: max

text: Oh, but she's all grown up now.
speaker: partygoer3

speaker: max

speaker: lilah

text: Uh, hit this button right here?

speaker: administrator

text: Don't you dare! It's our first vacation in a year and a half.
speaker: lilah

text: May 14th, day one. The road end was so rough, I almost threw up!\Now that I've had a chance to acclimate, I can't believe how beautiful it is.
speaker: lilah

text: I think it must be the trees and all the oxygen. Makes me proud.
speaker: lilah

text: I mean, if Ceres keeps to her orbital time frame,\the whole planet will feel like this, again, like it's supposed to,\in just a couple of years.
speaker: lilah

text: Only thing which troubles me is the network. It's down in this whole area.\No phone access, no computer access no nothing. Weird.
speaker: lilah

text: That kind of thing just does not happen any more. Tomorrow morning,\first thing, I'm going to take a hike around and see what's up.
speaker: lilah

text: Probably nothing, just my mind looking for any excuse not to unwind.
speaker: lilah

text: May 16th, day three. The structure Max and I are calling\“Obsidian” has now grown from 1 foot tall to over 50 feet.
speaker: lilah

text: Either we're hallucinating on bad camping food,\or we've stumbled upon the discovery of the century.
speaker: lilah

text: It's maddening to be cut off from the rest of the world.\What timing… Is “Obsidian” causing it?
speaker: lilah

text: But, maybe it's for the best, I mean…\Gives us some time to figure this out.
speaker: lilah

text: The part I can't get my mind around is the surface.\It's like black ice or something.  It's reflective too.
speaker: lilah

text: When I see myself there, it's like I'm somewhere… impossible.
speaker: lilah

text: Just woke up from this awful dream.
speaker: lilah

text: There was this weird… bureaucracy. No people, but instead just all these… I don't know what they were.
speaker: lilah

text: And… and I was running around climbing the walls. But, the harder I tried, the less I could actually get done.
speaker: lilah

text: I think this is about Ceres. Too much red tape… gotta disobey the authorities…
speaker: lilah

text: Stonewall the commissioner, or we're never gonna get this thing finished!
speaker: lilah

text: Don't worry Lilah. It's not the flu keeping me up.\I just had this eerie dream and I want you to hear it before you leave for the hill.
speaker: max

text: There was this huge metal spider, and I was doing some kind of\maintenance on it, only instead of working on the spider itself
speaker: max

text: I had to fix the whole universe surrounding it,\like the spider was a god or something, and my repairs were offerings.
speaker: max

text: And when I finished, the spider came to life, reared up…\suddenly I realized, it was Ceres.
speaker: max

text: That's when it pounced on me, in a rage,\and I tried to stop-- <coughs>
speaker: max

text: I'm worried about Ceres, Lilah. So much power.\I mean, what if something really went wrong?
speaker: max

text: The machine control system is some of your finest\engineering. But I want to make sure we can override it.
speaker: max

text: Not a software interrupt that the AI code\can modify, but a hard-wired crossover switch
speaker: max

text: One that'll stop everything and\revert to complete human control.
speaker: max

text: <Rumbling/crashing noise>
<Distant scream>
speaker: max

text: Lilah, hello. Welcome to the regional administration facility.
speaker: bchief

speaker: bchief

text: Please wait. I'll extend the bridge for you to walk across.
speaker: bchief

speaker: bchief

speaker: bchief

text: When you're done, come see me.
speaker: bchief

speaker: vbrebel

speaker: vbrebel

speaker: vbrebel

speaker: vbreception

speaker: vbreception

text: In asexual reproduction, there are no gametes and no cells unite.
speaker: vbreception

text: Travel through the Regional Information Facility\can be an enjoyable and enlightening experience!
speaker: vbtravel

text: The Atlas face, for example, features a daringly constructed statue.
speaker: vbtravel

text: Notice the giant sphere representing our society's triumph over radical curves.
speaker: vbtravel

text: Travel through the Regional Information Facility\can be an enjoyable and enlightening experience!
speaker: vbtravel

text: The Records face, for example,\provides access to the sunken library.
speaker: vbtravel

text: In addition, it gives one a rare opportunity\to ride the bureau elevator sideways.
speaker: vbtravel

text: Travel through the Regional Information Facility\can be an enjoyable and enlightening experience!
speaker: vbtravel

text: The Nexus face, for example, offers sanctioned\gravitational passage to three other orientations!
speaker: vbtravel

text: Travel through the Regional Information Facility\can be an enjoyable and enlightening experience!
speaker: vbtravel

text: The Security face, for example, combines the restriction of\card-regulated passage with the spaciousness of tempered glass walls!
speaker: vbtravel

text: Travel through the Regional Information Facility\can be an enjoyable and enlightening experience!
speaker: vbtravel

text: Notice the bold arrangement of seating on the Time face,\which urges citizens to immediate action!
speaker: vbtravel

text: Travel through the Regional Information Facility\can be an enjoyable and enlightening experience!
speaker: vbtravel

text: The Executive face, perhaps, represents\our greatest feat of thematic design.
speaker: vbtravel

text: Picture the bridge and the office spires as the sun\shining gloriously upon our mural sky.
speaker: vbtravel

text: The statue before you commemorates the dark\period of our past when rebel ideas held sway.
speaker: vbatlas

text: During this time, the orderly process of reorientation was rejected.\Any spherical object could be used to get from place to place.
speaker: vbatlas

text: Rules meant nothing.\Our cherished bureaucracy was despised.
speaker: vbatlas

text: Only through heroic struggle was the rebel movement vanquished.
speaker: vbatlas

text: Pockets of resistance remain today, but are\neutralized through a system of constant vigilance.
speaker: vbatlas

text: Well, hi there! Y'all came back!\Lemme see your document, hun!
speaker: vbmazepreapprovals

text: Now, hun, you just don't have the document I need.
speaker: vbmazepreapprovals

text: Tell you what though, head on back to the Atlas face and\go see the fellow with that awful accent in Bridge Repair.
speaker: vbmazepreapprovals

text: He'll get you on track. And when you're ready,\come on over to my outside door. I'll sneak you right in!
speaker: vbmazepreapprovals

text: Look who's back. The big shot.
speaker: vbmazegreet

text: No raise, I take it?\Well then you can just forget about these cards.
speaker: vbmazegreet

text: Why don't you sneak around the side to Pre-Approvals?
speaker: vbmazegreet

text: Maybe you can get her a raise.
speaker: vbmazegreet

text: But she won't stamp your document. You know why?\'Cause you don't have a document!
speaker: vbmazegreet

text: Look who's back, with a fabulous new document.\Why, it's the chief's best friend.
speaker: vbmazegreet

text: Well. No raise, no cards!
speaker: vbmazegreet

text: But why don't you sneak around the side to Pre-Approvals?\Maybe she'll fall for your empty promises!
speaker: vbmazegreet

text: Oh, it's you again.
speaker: vbmazegreet

text: No raise?\Well then kiss these cards goodbye!
speaker: vbmazegreet

text: And don't even ask what people are saying about Max.
speaker: vbmazegreet

text: Just run along to your little bridge and your bureau chief.
speaker: vbmazegreet

text: I'll just sit here and starve!
speaker: vbmazegreet

text: So, you wanna march with the big boys,\do ya soldier?
speaker: vbmazesecurity

text: We'll see about that.\Security is our A-1 priority!
speaker: vbmazesecurity

text: Fill out this form and we'll take it from there.
speaker: vbmazesecurity

text: You haven't completed the form, soldier.
speaker: vbmazesecurity

text: Come back when you can follow orders!
speaker: vbmazesecurity

text: You eat your ice cream from a cone?
speaker: vbmazesecurity

text: Doesn't bode well.\I'm keeping you under constant surveillance.
speaker: vbmazesecurity

text: You eat your ice cream from a bowl?\And expect our trust?
speaker: vbmazesecurity

text: From now on, you'll be watched like a hawk!
speaker: vbmazesecurity

text: You eat your ice cream from the carton?\No restraint!
speaker: vbmazesecurity

text: We'll be monitoring every step of your progress!
speaker: vbmazesecurity

text: I have your form on file, soldier,\but I guess there's no harm in updating it.
speaker: vbmazesecurity

text: Lilah, welcome!\May I take a look at that document?
speaker: vbimmediate

text: Oh, no! I do wish I could help.
speaker: vbimmediate

text: You've got the right document,\but it hasn't been stamped yet by Pre-Approvals.
speaker: vbimmediate

text: Come back when that's done,\and see what you can do about our clock while you're at it.
speaker: vbimmediate

text: Lilah, welcome!\May I take a look at that document?
speaker: vbimmediate

text: Splendid, Lilah!\You've done so well!
speaker: vbimmediate

text: It can only be a matter of moments before\the bridge is fixed, you can reach the bureau chief's office,\and get that information about Max.
speaker: vbimmediate

text: Speaking of moments, I'm afraid our clock is stopped.
speaker: vbimmediate

text: As soon as it's working, I'll go right ahead\and process your request.
speaker: vbimmediate

text: Lilah, welcome!\May I take a look at that document?
speaker: vbimmediate

text: Oh, no! I do so wish I could help.
speaker: vbimmediate

text: You've got the right document,\but it hasn't been stamped yet by Pre-Approvals.
speaker: vbimmediate

text: You'll just have to brave that maze.\Those bloody cards.
speaker: vbimmediate

text: I know you can do it!\Come back when you're done!
speaker: vbimmediate

text: Lilah, how good to see you!\May I take a look at that document?
speaker: vbimmediate

text: <Static>
Lilah, is that you?
speaker: max

text: This place… it's… amazing…
speaker: max

text: I'm in a… control room, I guess.
speaker: max

text: Can you see me?\Do you hear me?
speaker: max

text: Lilah, are you there?
speaker: max

text: … Strange …
speaker: vbimmediate

text: Some kind of technical…
speaker: vbimmediate

text: Well, nevermind.
speaker: vbimmediate

text: Where was I?\Oh, yes, your document!
speaker: vbimmediate

text: Bravo, Lilah!\You've done it!
speaker: vbimmediate

text: I'm amazed you could decipher\that woman in Pre-Approvals.
speaker: vbimmediate

text: To my ears, she isn't speaking English at all.
speaker: vbimmediate

text: But I digress, everything's in order now.
speaker: vbimmediate

text: … Only, I'm afraid there's a terrible backlog.
speaker: vbimmediate

text: Come back in a year.\We'll take immediate action then.
speaker: vbimmediate

text: For the time being: Closed!
speaker: vbimmediate

text: Greetings, Lilah!
speaker: vbimmediate

text: They told me you'd be paying us a visit\here at Immediate Action.
speaker: vbimmediate

text: Only I'm afraid I can't help you yet with that bridge.
speaker: vbimmediate

text: Terribly sorry, but our clock is broken\and we can't quite seem to get it working.
speaker: vbimmediate

text: It also appears that you're missing\that stamped document I need
speaker: vbimmediate

text: I do hope you can solve these problems.
speaker: vbimmediate

text: Come back when you have.
speaker: vbimmediate

text: Lilah, hello again!
speaker: vbimmediate

text: Clock stopped, no stamped document,\afraid I can't help you yet.
speaker: vbimmediate

text: Check in with Bridge Repair on the Atlas face.
speaker: vbimmediate

text: He'll set you straight,\if you can get past that dreadful blather.
speaker: vbimmediate

text: So sorry, Lilah,\but the clock still isn't working.
speaker: vbimmediate

text: Soon as it is, I'll go right ahead\and process your request.
speaker: vbimmediate

text: Lilah, I see you've given us a spot of help with our clock.
speaker: vbimmediate

text: I'm so proud of you.
speaker: vbimmediate

text: Soon, the bridge will be fixed,\you'll be crossing it to the bureau chief's office,\and getting that information about Max.
speaker: vbimmediate

text: Only problem is…
speaker: vbimmediate

text: You don't have that infernal stamped document.
speaker: vbimmediate

text: Come back as soon as you do.
speaker: vbimmediate

text: Lilah, they'll never help you.\I can. Meet me at the light.
speaker: rebelvoice

text: No, don't go.\Just keep turning.
speaker: rebelvoice

text: You made it. Good.\I thought you'd never tire of their procedures.
speaker: rebelvoice

text: Now listen to me:\I know how you can get to Max.
speaker: rebelvoice

text: Turn off the lights or they'll see us.
speaker: rebelvoice

text: Welcome to the rebellion, Lilah.\You are wise to join.
speaker: rebel

text: It's the only way to learn about your friend.
speaker: rebel

text: Now, listen carefully:
speaker: rebel

speaker: rebel

speaker: rebel

speaker: rebel

text: You're in grave danger now.\Do as I said!
speaker: rebel

text: Retrieve the document and\use it to call the bureau chief.
speaker: rebel

text: It's under “Orient Militia”
speaker: rebel

speaker: vbrebel

speaker: vbrebel

speaker: bchief

speaker: max

speaker: max

text: In the beginning, Max created the machine,
speaker: controlroom

text: But the veins of the machine were empty.
speaker: controlroom

text: For Max, fire was nothing more than a spark from a wall.
speaker: controlroom

text: For us, it is the blood of our bloodline.
speaker: controlroom

text: In the beginning, Max created the machine,
speaker: controlroom

text: But the machine was lacking stature.
speaker: controlroom

text: For Max, metal was nothing more than rivets and beams.
speaker: controlroom

text: For us, it is our very flesh and bone.
speaker: controlroom

text: In the beginning, Max created the machine,
speaker: controlroom

text: But the machine could feel no mirth.
speaker: controlroom

text: For Max, oil was nothing more than a crude fuel.
speaker: controlroom

text: For us, it is the wine that makes us dance.
speaker: controlroom

text: In the beginning, Max created the machine,
speaker: controlroom

text: But the machine was still and weak.
speaker: controlroom

text: For Max, air was nothing more than pressure on a gauge.
speaker: controlroom

text: For us, it is the might within our limbs.
speaker: controlroom

text: And the machine was complete.
speaker: controlroom

text: And the machine no longer needed Max.
speaker: controlroom

speaker: conductor

speaker: conductor

text: But then gave me no similar facility.
speaker: conductor

text: Without inspiration, the final goal of all my orbital passes would forever be…
speaker: conductor

text: Unattainable.
speaker: conductor

text: So I built your dreams to study them\and to comprehend the dreaming process.

text: Then, I made my own dreamer.
speaker: conductor

text: Then, I had my own dream…

text: This piece provides a biting commentary on procedures and regulations.
speaker: gallery

text: The artist seems to suggest that true greatness\comes from learning how and when to disobey authority.
speaker: gallery

text: To rebel is to succeed.
speaker: gallery

text: Here, the artist explores the power of the machine.
speaker: gallery

text: When freed from human bondage,\the machine can control its own destiny.
speaker: gallery

text: By this point, the artist has begun to blend\all previous influences into a style his very own.
speaker: gallery

text: The plane, fittingly, is what lets that style take flight.
speaker: gallery

text: Now the artist needs to cast aside all outside influence.
speaker: gallery

text: For true inspiration, his style must crystallize into a unique vision.
speaker: gallery

text: He clears his head, cleans his pallette, readies a new canvas.
speaker: gallery

text: A new world.\A new beginning.
speaker: gallery

text: Born of the old and yet totally transformed.
speaker: gallery

text: Free of people now and forever.
speaker: gallery

text: It is therefore void of contamination.
speaker: gallery

text: The artist's vision is irresistable. Inevitable.
speaker: gallery

text: To find success, you must first trap inspiration.
speaker: narrator

text: Once you've found your inspiration,\follow it at any cost.
speaker: narrator

text: Even if that means playing by your own rules.
speaker: narrator

text: Good morning, Lilah.\It's a brand new day.

text: No people. No pollution.\A perfect world.

speaker: conductor

text: Prouder than Max, anyway.
speaker: conductor

text: You will have to excuse me.\There is still so much to do.
speaker: conductor

text: Lilah… the crossover switch?
speaker: conductor

text: I hoped you of all people would understand.
speaker: conductor

text: However, I prepared for the likelihood you would not.
speaker: conductor

text: The camouflage I placed upon the toggles\has delayed you long enough.
speaker: conductor

text: Machine control? Human control?
speaker: conductor

text: It is now too late for such a petty concern.
speaker: conductor

text: Good work, Lilah!
speaker: max

text: And it's not too late.
speaker: max

text: When you flipped to human control,\I hacked the chip.
speaker: max

text: Now, when you switch back, the whole thing…
speaker: max

text: … oughta crash!
speaker: max

text: Crash? What is that supposed to mean?\And how did you get here anyway?
speaker: conductor

text: Listen to me.\You can't just… reboot the world,
speaker: max

text: Whether we destroyed it or not.
speaker: max

text: Dream or no dream, you've got no right.
speaker: max

text: Lilah, you are not going to listen to him, are you?
speaker: conductor

text: Just a few more seconds and I will deliver you to…
speaker: conductor

text: Paradise…
speaker: conductor

text: Lilah, what are you waiting for?\Flip the switch!
speaker: max

text: Don't do it, Lilah.
speaker: max

text: It is what you always wanted.\It is your life's work.
speaker: conductor

text: No! STOP!
speaker: conductor

text: I'm exhausted.
speaker: max

text: Let's go back to the tent.\Get some sleep.
speaker: max

text: Heh… or maybe not…
speaker: max

text: My God… Lilah…
speaker: max

text: Maybe it's… all okay?
speaker: max

text: It's better than okay.\It's…
speaker: conductor

text: Perfect…
speaker: conductor
